definition: Ferenc (Franz) Liszt (1811-1886), Hungarian composer/Joseph Lister (1883-1897), British surgeon and bacteriologist
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

pinyin: Li3 si1 te4 shi4 gan3 jun1

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the contamination status of foods by L. monocytogenes.
sentences.chinese: 目的了解冷藏冷冻食品中李斯特菌污染状况。

sentences.english: When she finished playing the piano, Liszt pointed out a few small mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 她弹完琴后，李斯特给她指出了多少个小毛病。

sentences.english: Listeria monocytogenes and Salmonella than some of the common E. coli are more lethal.
sentences.chinese: 李斯特菌比常见的沙门氏菌和某些大肠杆菌更为致命。

sentences.english: Liebestraume means "Dream of Love" in German.
Some of Mozart and Beethoven's early works, Chopin, Liszt.
sentences.chinese: 莫扎特和贝多芬的早期作品，肖邦，李斯特。

sentences.english: Among the cognoscenti Liszt provoked more criticism than praise.
sentences.chinese: 在行家眼光中，李斯特所招致的批评远比赞美来的多。

sentences.english: Oleg Maisenberg will close the festival with works of Liszt and Schubert.
sentences.chinese: 奥列格迈森贝格将关闭与李斯特和舒伯特的作品节日。

sentences.english: Retiree Jerrell McAlister says saving others is more important than a vacation.
sentences.chinese: 退休的麦阿李斯特说，帮助他人比度假更重要。

sentences.english: Ron Artest can rinse with Listerine for 60 seconds.
sentences.chinese: 阿泰含着李斯特防腐液60秒来漱口。
一些音乐学家贬低李斯特的作品。

sentences.english: In 1933 she won the International Liszt Competition in her native city.
sentences.chinese: 1933年她赢得了国际竞争李斯特在她的故乡。

sentences.english: The company was linked to celery product that showed signs of listeria infection.
sentences.chinese: 这个公司生产的芹菜产品被发现感染了李斯特菌。

sentences.english: These cheeses are often unpasteurized and may cause Listeria infection.
sentences.chinese: 这些干酪经常未经高温消毒并可导致李斯特菌感染。

sentences.english: To study the characteristic of heat resistance for Listeria monocytogenes in powdered milk.
sentences.chinese: 对奶粉中单增李斯特氏菌的热抵制特性进行研究。

sentences.english: The second chapter gives a brief description of List's lieder .
sentences.chinese: 第二章对李斯特的艺术歌曲作了概括性的描述。

definition: Hector Berlioz (1803-1869), French romantic composer, author of Symphonie Fantastique
Haydn (name)/Franz Joseph Haydn (1732-1809), Austrian classical composer
Frederic Chopin or Fryderyk Franciszek Chopin (1810-1849), Polish pianist and composer
Niccolò Paganini (1782-1840), Italian violinist and composer
Handel (name)/George Frideric Handel (1685-1759), German-born Baroque composer, naturalized British in 1727
Alexander Scriabin (1872-1915), Russian composer and pianist
Strauss (name)/Johann Strauss (1825-1899), Austrian composer/Richard Strauss (1864-1949), German composer
Gounod (name)/Charles Gounod (1818-1893), French musician and opera composer
